page.title: 09THE BULLOCKS ON HILL FARM
page.content:
We visited Hill Farm, near Cheveley. It is 350 acres and is one of the three local farms owned by Lord Fairhaven. They have a total of 2,000 acres. Hill Farm is the only one with any farm animals on it now. Mrs Bowyer, the tenant of Hill Farm, showed us the animals: fifteen bullocks. Bullocks are bulls that have had an operation to make them calm so that they are "its". The farm buys the bullocks when they are four months old and they live there until they are eighteen months old. Then they go to market. They are slaughtered in a kind way and then go to the butchers' shops where they are cut up for meat.
*********
